result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ladaytren Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ladaytren Jackson appeared by video.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal appeared by video for Ladaytren Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Victims present via zoom. Status conference held. Defense has discovery and is waiting on an offer. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ladaytren Jackson in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Ladaytren Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court vacates stayed bench warrant. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned for status conference by Zoom, Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Ladaytren Jackson not in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Ladaytren Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.
Defense counsel informed the Court that a TAD evaluation was completed. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. 
Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 30.
Calendar call scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ladaytren Jackson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ladaytren Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests to solve the case through a deferred prosecution agreement. Defendant needs to complete TAD evaluation. Discussion held.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ladaytren Jackson in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status. Defense counsel has not yet been appointed. Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel. Case remains calendared in Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bail previosuly posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with WDT.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.

Defendant Ladaytren Jackson in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
04/18/22.    22RM020253
